Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2022/0712 b) Date of Occurrence: 13/10/2024
c) Installation Details: Sentinel-15 - AC-4620-871 at Base
Echo
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Propulsion b) Date Component 20/10/2024
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Compressor Section d) Main Assembly: Station-2 Port
e) Nomenclature: Compressor Section Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: Standard
g) Part No.: PR-7437-R7 h) Sl No.: SN-9609-267
i) Firmware Version: Not Applicable j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 15/09/2020 l) Date of Removal: 19/10/2024
Pg No: 90 Ln No: 30 Pg No: 94 Ln No: 17
m) Manufacturing Agency: Precision Avionics Corp n) Date, Month & Year December 2016
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: Yes p) Whether under AMC No
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 2551 Hrs / 1007 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Minor
b) Defect Observed: Fuel control unit drift. Abnormality observed during system test.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Contamination ingress through damaged seal assembly
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Compressor Section component.
Functional testing confirmed the reported anomaly.
c) Remedial Measures Adjust calibration settings to manufacturer specifications
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Issue technical bulletin to all operators
d) Attributable Code: N - Not established
Remarks: Detailed examination conducted. Corrective measures implemented.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Design assessment confirms component operated within specified limits. Recommend enhanced inspection protocol.
Date: 06/11/2024 Authorized Signatory of Design: Wg Cdr D.S. Nair

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Component inspection records verified. All quality parameters were within acceptable limits during manufacturing.
Date: 07/11/2024 Signature: Eng. R.P. Singh
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
User feedback incorporated. Recommend enhanced crew training on system operation and limitations.
Date: 10/11/2024 Signature: Wg Cdr M.S. Reddy
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
Regulatory quality requirements verified. Proposed actions meet airworthiness standards. Recommend approval.
Date: 11/11/2024 Signature: Dr. S.M. Kulkarni
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
Design authority review completed. Recommend continued airworthiness monitoring of affected component type.
Date: 11/11/2024 Signature: Dr. S.M. Kulkarni
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
